items.name: Dr. Tom Ricks
items.title: EPC National Church Planting Team Leader
items.text: One of the biggest needs for a church planter is handling the business aspects of birthing a church. However, it is usually one thing about which the planter knows the least.  Phil’s expertise in operations and organization is the answer to this need. Anyone planting a church that needs help on the business side of the ledger should do themselves a favor and contact Phil!  He’s been a huge help to several of our EPC church plants.

items.name: Rev. Brian Roskin
items.title: River City Church (EPC) St. Charles, MO
items.text: Phil was absolutely instrumental as our localization process moved forward. He allowed me to focus on what God has called me to do while he has done what God has called him to do. As a result, God has been and will continue to be glorified.

items.name: Philip D. Douglass, PhD
items.title: Professor Emeritus of Applied Theology, Covenant Theological Seminary Director of Church Planting, Growth and Renewal, Missouri Presbytery of the PCA
items.text: A church’s calling is Worship, Fellowship, Discipleship, Ministry and Mission, about which pastors receive instruction in how to lead while in seminary. However, very little training is provided in how to establish a church’s infrastructure that manages these biblical functions in a God-honoring way. Therefore, Phil's ministry is very valuable to help guide church planters and pastors of existing churches in developing or improving the organizational systems that empower the church’s essential purposes.
